intro: Keckiella breviflora var. glabrisepala, commonly known as the smooth-sepaled keckiella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are trifoliate, with each leaflet being narrow and hairy, while the flowers are usually pink or purple. The variety glabrisepala is distinguished by its smooth, hairless sepals, which set it apart from other varieties of Keckiella breviflora.
